naics.NAICS_Title: Apparel Accessories and Other Apparel Manufacturing

data.summaryOfProcurement: Cold Weather Hoods are to be issued to Navy personnel during wartime or periods of mobilization.  Cold Weather Hood with Mask must be Waterproof and contain Fleece Lining, Twill Main Body, Hook Pile fastener Tape, Visor, Rubber Chloroprene inside, with ear pods, protective nose flaps, buckle webbing adjustment assembly, to be use w/helmet, flight deck..
data.urgencyContributedExplanation: Supply Chain Issues and compressed need by date.
data.waiverRationaleSummary: These hoods are mission essential for flight deck operations. Accent Apparel is the only source identified that was able to provide the required quantity which could meet the MILSPECS, and deliver the hoods by the required need date in time for the crew to inventory prior to load out of the USS Fort Lauderdale.
data.anticipatedMissionImpactNoWaiver: Cold Weather Hoods would not have been received in time for crew inventory and load out of the USS Fort Lauderdale.  This would have resulted in the either a delay in schedule of the USS Fort Loaduerdale or non-compliance of mission required materials.

psc.pscName: MEDICAL AND SURGICAL INSTRUMENTS, EQUIPMENT, AND SUPPLIES

data.urgencyContributedExplanation: Domestic sources, if given enough time (24-36 months) could potentially meet the overall requirement, but insufficient sources exist at this time to meet national COVID-19 testing requirement in at the scale required, using products cleared by the FDA for over the counter (OTC) use, that would not interfere with current planned distribution to the US commercial marketplace.
data.waiverRationaleSummary: The Government requires the estimated 500 million COVID-19 tests within 60 calendar days of award. The 500M COVID-19 Test kits are necessary in order to maintain the safety of the American population as the National Institute of Health has projected a shortfall of over 500 Million tests on the market by 21 January 2022.
data.anticipatedMissionImpactNoWaiver: The mission would not be met in time to respond to Presidential directive,  health requirements, and urgent national testing distribution, leading to the potential for additional pandemic spread across the nation.
